contentrichtext.text: {{distinguish|Ping Chau}} {{expand language|topic=|langcode=zh|otherarticle=|date=July 2012}} [[Image:Peng Chau location map.svg|right|thumb|Location of Peng Chau within HKSAR]] [[Image:Peng chau.jpg|right|thumb|Peng Chau viewed from Lantau Island.]] [[Image:Port of peng chau.jpg|thumb|[[Peng Chau Ferry Pier]].]] '''Peng Chau''' ({{zh|t=坪洲}}, [[Jyutping]]: ping4 zau1) is a small [[island]] located off the north-eastern coast of [[Lantau Island]], [[Hong Kong]], which has an area of 0.99 km². Peng Chau is known for its small island lifestyle, accessibility to fresh seafood, and several temples located around the island (including a [[Matsu (goddess)|Tin Hau]] temple built in 1792). The tallest point of the island is Finger Hill, which is 95m in height and provides hiking opportunities for those who seek them. As of April 2003, the island is undergoing land degradation restorative work. ==Transportation== [[File:Peng Lee Road.jpg|thumb|Peng Lei Road.]] The main mode of transportation on the island is the bicycle; there are no motor cars apart from small construction and emergency vehicles. Peng Chau is accessible by a [[ferry]] ([[Hong Kong and Kowloon Ferry]]) from [[Central and Western district|Central]] on [[Hong Kong Island]], or by ferries from [[Mui Wo]], [[Chi Ma Wan]] and [[Cheung Chau]] ([[New World First Ferry]]), or by [[Kai-to]] ferries from [[Discovery Bay]] on Lantau Island. Helicopters are sometimes used in medical emergencies. Peng Chau is linked to '''Tai Lei Island''' by a bridge. The bridge is part of Peng Lei Road. It is a popular fishing spot. ==Famous people== Hong Kong famous footballer [[Lee Kin Wo]] lives on Peng Chau with his family. ==See also== * [[Islands of Hong Kong]] * [[List of buildings, sites and areas in Hong Kong]] ==External links== {{Commonscat}} * [http://www.discoverhongkong.com/promotions/greatoutdoors/eng/html/hikings/hikings_pengchau.html Peng Chau] - Peng Chau page at the Hong Kong Tourism Board. * [http://programme.rthk.hk/rthk/tv/programme.php?name=tv/hkstories9e&d=2010-09-15&p=4907&e=117629&m=episode Simple Life in Peng Chau] - TV program by the [[Radio Television Hong Kong]] on Peng Chau ([http://www.rthk.org.hk/asx/rthk/tv/hkstories9e/20100915.asx video archive]). * [http://www.greenpengchau.org.hk Green Peng Chau Association] * [http://sites.google.com/site/lescopainspengchau/ Les copains d'abord Cafe boutique]} {{Islands of Hong Kong}} {{Coord|22|17|7|N|114|2|19|E|display=title|type:isle}} [[Category:Islands District]] [[Category:Peng Chau| ]]
